entry.title: Reconsider whether IdentityManager completely disabling scope checking is the right approach
entry.content:
As part of crbug.com/40066882, https://crrev.com/c/4786107 introduced a parameter to bypass scope access validation on iOS, with TODOs to do the same on other platforms.
During a code review, bsazonov@ pointed out that this may not be the desired end state.
This bug is about reconsidering this decision and possibly coming up with a better replacement to fully disabling scope access validation.

entry.title: Constant mat2x2[2] in glsl breaks metal backend
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 122.0.6261.49 (Official Build) (arm64) OS: MacOS 13.6.4
What steps will reproduce the problem?
(1) Set "Choose ANGLE graphics backend" to "Metal" in chrome://flags/ (2) Open attached mat2x2[2].html
What is the expected result?
* A blue rectangle should be shown
What happens instead?
* Nothing is shown.
* The following error is shown in the Developer Console
[.WebGL-0x13400c27000] GL_INVALID_OPERATION: Error: 0x00000502, in ../../third_party/angle/src/libANGLE/renderer/metal/mtl_utils.mm, CreateMslShader:1810. Metal backend encountered an error

entry.title: Unable to share screen in Google meet after leaving share pop-up idle for about 3 minutes
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6310.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) 98320a8d4b6a12a0f142eeaffa98831bc0e7a487-refs/branch-heads/6310@{#1}
OS : Mac,Win(10,11),Linux
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and join any Google meet 2. Click on Share icon 3. Leave the system idle for about 3 minutes 4. Click on any option to share: tab, window or entire screen 5. Observe the error message: Can’t share your screen - Sorry, an error has occurred when screen sharing
Actual Result: “Can’t share your screen - Sorry, an error has occurred when screen sharing” message is observed
Expected Result: Screen sharing must happen
This issue exists from M-111 onwards .So, raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the screenshot below: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ysYDzYktaC2tLC-u8lxmH5fwxQRq8TfI/view?usp=drive_link
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Beta #122.0.6261.49, Dev #123.0.6300.3 and Stable #122.0.6261.49 2)As this is a Non-Regression issue, changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: Recalculate layout with rule.style change while opened devtools
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open rule.style.html in google chrome or another chromium browser 2. open devtools 3. click the button (one or many times)
# Problem Description You'll see that the text positioned on left: 150px, not 999px. That happens because in for loop construction we read the offsetLeft of the element, and therefore layout was calculated on this position. But after exiting the loop, we can see that the layout not recalculated, even css styles show that left is 999px, but getComputedStyle().left will show 150px.
Line `$div.style.cssText = $div.style.cssText;` will fix layout recalculation. Any change on element.style will force recalculate layout. Properties that usually triggers recalculate layout like offsetLeft, offsetHeight or method getBoundingClientRect will not force recalculate layout. Closed devtools will fix layout recalculation. Starting Performance record will force recalculate.
# Additional Comments I noticed that the CSSStyleDeclaration from CSSStyleRule will not works properly with opened devtools, but CSSStyleDeclaration from element.style works properly.
# Summary Recalculate layout with rule.style change while opened devtools
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Request for Feedback
entry.content:
*Instructions:*
*1) Choose if this is a general question about the project (if so choose template 1) or if this is a request for a review of a proposal (if so choose template 2 below)*
*2) Fill in the template completely and delete the instructions and the unused template*
*3) Update the title to reflect your question or "proposal submission for <your name>"*
*4) Submit and wait for the mentors to provide feedback*.
*--------------- Template 1 ------------------*
**Question about Project**
*Delete this and the below paragraphs and ask your question here, recall that there is lots of material for routine questions. Please go through the [project list](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/15tLikPVkKrkz53RVG1ncY-8PpWA4dgZU0-5kl-uB4dg/edit#slide=id.g1f110b421e3_1_95), if you are interested get started on the starter bugs / starter milestone listed on the project doc of each project.*
*If you want a head start or interested in contributing to chromium you can check out the “[Life of a Chromium Developer](https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/chromium-dev/c/ybLzH8-FoTc/m/YhTe2g9L7CUJ)”, “[contributing](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/contributing.md)”, or “[getting involved](https://www.chromium.org/getting-involved)” for information about getting the code and general flow of making a change to the code base.*
*If you have general questions not about a project you should instead email the mailing list chromium-gsoc@chromium.org and the admins can assist you.*
*--------------- Template 2 ------------------*
**Request For Project Proposal Review**
Please use our [template for a proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IOj4hSdPl8h1-8zYK_Gt3OxA0R44SLbmr-ZH3f9yDXM/edit?usp=sharing)
But we also encourage you to read GSoC's [writing a proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/writing-a-proposal) and [example proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/proposal-example-1). We suggest you reach out early engage with the starter bug of your project, and submit a proposal soon after you have a handle on the problem.
* Link to Google doc that contains your proposal: * Desired Project length (if different from project slide's suggestions): * Desired Project size (if different from project slide's suggestions): *Small/Medium/Large* * Any additional comments:

|

|
+-->ViewStub{id=16908682, res-name=action_mode_bar_stub, visibility=GONE, width=0, height=0, has-focus=false, has-...

entry.title: Dynamic video 'scrubbing' with JS and currentTime not working since last update.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open codepen in chrome and scroll down, video should scrub through - it doesn't 2. Open codepen in safari and scroll down, video scrubs through the progress smoothly
# Problem Description Hi there -
This codepen ties the scroll progress to the video progress by tapping into currentTime. In the latest version of chrome this video doesn't scrub smoothly, it takes a few seconds to catch up and then "jumps" to the new time stamp.
# Additional Comments Here's a codepen demostrating the issue. Thanks!
https://codepen.io/GreenSock/pen/WNmmaBd
# Summary Dynamic video 'scrubbing' with JS and currentTime not working since last update.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Media
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: requestVideoFrameCallback does not contain captureTimestamp when abs-capture-time header extension is negotiated
Do something with CSS*InterpolationTypes that use double only InterpolableNumber
entry.content:
Some CSS*InterpolationTypes use InterpolableNumber as double-only storage (no css math expression), so, calls to InterpolableNumber::Value(length_resolver) look as an overkill as a use of InterpolableNumber itself.
Think about what to do with it later. Maybe reintroduce InterpolableDouble?

entry.title: Memory consumption is increasing after every page reload if developer tools are open.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open any website - for example https://google.com 2. Open developer tools and Memory tab 3. Reload page. 4. As result memory consumed by main thread is increasing after every reload.
# Problem Description Reproduced on 3 out of 4MacBooks Pro (M1 and M2 processors). "Preserve log" options in Network and Console tabs are turned off.
# Summary Memory consumption is increasing after every page reload if developer tools are open.
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Print does not respect bottom margin
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open the attached HTML 2. Open Print Preview 3. Choose Paper size A5 and Custom margins (0.39'' all, bottom 1.6'')
# Problem Description The bottom margin in HTML on the body is not respected. It's large enough to fit the footer however the footer overlaps the content. See the attached bad.png. Setting paper margin to e.g. 1.18'' renders correctly, see attached ok.png
It used to work fine e.g. in Chrome 84
# Summary Print does not respect bottom margin
# Custom Questions #### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Which other browsers (including versions) also have the problem? Firefox prints footer on the first page, it should be on the second page.
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: [iOS] check_static_initializer.py has no effect on Chromium.app
entry.content:
Hi team,
Based on previous 'check_static_initializer.py' has supported for ios (https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4233899):
I find some static initializers in Chromium by xcode instruments (picture 1). I try to use 'check_static_initializer.py' to check the 'Chromium.app' but it can't detect any static initializer (picture 2). I debugged and found that the variable 'rc' detected was 0. I try to commit a cl 'https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5302978' to test check_static_initializers.py is or not worked. Theoretically it should not pass the CQ DRY RUN, but it passed.
My question is why the script has no effect on 'Chromium.app'. Is there any special reason or the script has been not worked?
Thanks!

As suggested in https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40285277#comment73, filing a new bug for visual glitches bug with enabled AllowUndamagedNonrootRenderPassToSkip feature.
Have a stable repro on a ToT Chromium Windows when running with flags "--enable-features=AllowUndamagedNonrootRenderPassToSkip --disable_direct_composition".
Sample page, video with reproduction and my gpu info areattached.

entry.title: Incorect include relation in trace from -ftime-trace?
entry.content:
When I compile [browser_non_client_frame_view_browsertest.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/frame/browser_non_client_frame_view_browsertest.cc) with -ftime-trace, I got a trace like https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=d15e3c06c52730e60c025dccc453ecace3691d5acaa9dc297aff77796c441308
But the trace is strange that chrome/browser/ui/views/location_bar/custom_tab_bar_view.h is appeared as child span of [chrome/browser/ui/views/frame/browser_view.h](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/frame/browser_view.h) which doesn't include the header file.
https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Az3AKuKna7bcfDQ
Similarly, [chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h) has child spans for chrome/browser/tab_contents/web_contents_collection.h and content/public/test/browser_test_base.h, but those are not included by profile.h as well.
https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Ahh2GvLT254YEWK
Why does -ftime-trace show such trace?
This makes it difficult to analyse bottleneck and remove unnecessary includes.

entry.title: Feature Request: Show 'source' of resource routed through the Service Worker Static Routing API
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Enable the Service Worker Static Routing API and add a route for a URL pattern that bypasses the Service Worker (i.e. by setting `source: "network"`). 2. Open the Network panel in DevTools. 3. Trigger a request for the resource(s) that should be requested from network.
# Problem Description Currently, "(ServiceWorker router)" is displayed in the Size column of the network panel for the routed resource. A more descriptive annotation — e.g. "(ServiceWorker: routed to network)", "(Routed to network)", or "(Routed to Service Worker)" — might be more helpful for debugging.
# Additional Comments For additional info, see issue on GitHub: https://github.com/WICG/service-worker-static-routing-api/issues/21
# Summary Feature Request: Show 'source' of resource routed through the Service Worker Static Routing API
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Dev \ Regression: No

entry.title: Excessive and consistent dropped frame observed av1 video playback on M3 Mac (hardware decode).
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open av1 mp4 file or play YouTube video with av1 stream on an M3 Mac. 2. Choppy playback. 3.
# Problem Description Example video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IY4x85zqoJM Turn on YouTube "Stats for nerds" and make sure av1 stream is played (like ID 399, 1080p)
I can confirm that Chrome is using hardware decoding for av1 on M3 since VTDecoderXPCService is active during playback.
Screen recording of observed frame drop uploaded as attachment. Chrome on the right is choppy. QuickTime on the left playing the same exact stream and it is smooth.
Also tested on Chrome Canary 123.0.6309.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) and the issue persists.
# Additional Comments Safari, QuickTime played the same av1 video fine.
# Summary Excessive and consistent dropped frame observed av1 video playback on M3 Mac (hardware decode).
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Assess potential impact of Swap-RFH-at-Commit on FCP & Paint Holding
entry.content:
I'm currently trying to figure out the potential impact for the Swap-RFH-at-Commit project (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RXGDkrSWTfaeio76joXKWBLGDHAbiB48sHUdcTX6rdc/edit?usp=sharing). The main areas to investigate are its impact (positive/negative) towards FCP time and how long will it extend Paint Holding, as a result of swapping in the new RenderFrameHost earlier (when asking the renderer to commit instead of when hearing back from the renderer that the commit is successful.
From discussions with CSA and compositor people, here are some hypothesis that we want to confirm: - Swapping RFH earlier might not affect FCP directly because the time it takes for the renderer to produce the first FCP frame will be greater than the time it takes to send the DidCommit IPC and embed the new RFH (i.e. swapping RFH is not a blocker for FCP). - Paint holding will be used for a longer duration because we swap the RFH earlier, but the time it takes to paint the first frame will be the same. This is a negative for security.
To confirm the above, we have some CLs to gather metrics: - crrev.com/c/5192269 records the time it takes between compositor creation to commit and to the current RFH swap time at DidCommit on the browser side. With this, we can see how long the compositor waits for surface embedding (RFH swap) from the browser side, which can be improved with Swap-RFH-at-commit. - crrev.com/c/5057424 records the time it takes between the submission of the FCP frame to when the surface gets embedded on the renderer side. With this, we can see how often the FCP frame waits for the surface embed (RFH swap) currently.
What's currently missing: - Metrics on current paint holding duration (not sure if this already exists). - Measuring the time it takes between navigation commit to FCP frame submission to DidCommit to surface embedding. I might add this in crrev.com/c/5057424 or make it a follow-up. This will help to estimate potential paint holding duration if we swap RFH earlier.
I'll probably make a doc soon to try to make the relations between timings and metrics more clear and also gather input to see if there are more things to consider.

entry.title: Unexpected mouseover Event Triggered with Always-on-Top Window
entry.content:
An unexpected 'mouseover' event is triggered when an always-on-top window overlays the browser window. This issue is observed exclusively on Windows. It does not occur in Linux or MacOS.
Detailed steps to reproduce this issue are outlined in the attached HTML file.

entry.title: Chrome crashes when using autocomplete feature on website(s). Experienced by others as well.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Navigate to MUI's official website and to the example for selecting countries. Link: https://mui.com/material-ui/react-autocomplete/#country-select 2. Tap the autocomplete and select a country. 3. Observe the browser tab crashing with the "Aw, snap" error page.
# Problem Description I and others are experiencing a recurring issue when using the Material-UI (MUI) autocomplete component in Google Chrome. The problem occurs consistently and has been observed not only in my own application but also on MUI's official website with their autocomplete component examples.
# Expected behavior: The autocomplete component should function as intended without causing the browser tab to crash.
# Additional information: - This issue seems to be specific to Google Chrome. The autocomplete component works as expected in other browsers such as Firefox. - Upon checking the developer tools console, no errors are outputted. - A similar issue has been reported on MUI's GitHub repository, but it has been suggested that this might be a Chromium issue. Link: https://github.com/mui/material-ui/issues/40877
# Environments: Mobile: Google Pixel 6 Pro Browser: Google Chrome 121.0.6167.178 Operating System: Android 14; Pixel 6 Pro Build/UQ1A.240205.002
In addition, it has been observed by others in MUI issue tracker mentioned above. This includes: Chrome version 121.0.6167.101 Android 14; Pixel 8 Pro Build/UQ1A.240105.004
However, co founder at MUI was unable to reproduce the error with his Chrome Mobile v121, Samsung S20 FE.
A couple of videos are also available in MUI issue tracker thread. Like this one: https://github.com/mui/material-ui/issues/40877#issuecomment-1936167049
# Additional Comments I have no plugins for Chrome on my Android.
# Summary Chrome crashes when using autocomplete feature on website(s). Experienced by others as well.
# Custom Questions #### Crashed report ID: No
#### How much crashed? Just one tab
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Stack overflow when loading HTML containing <style> with too many vars()
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Load the provided HTML file in Google Chrome (works with both file:// and http://) 2. Wait a few seconds while the page is "loading" 3. The tab crashes with "Aw, Snap!" and "Error code: SIGSEGV"
# Problem Description While trying to research CSS exfiltration techniques, I stumbled upon a SIGSEGV when trying to load an HTML page containing too many CSS var() in a <style> element. For some reason, the crash seems to only occur if the number of vars is between approx 105000 and 190000. The page loads correctly outside of this bounds.
When debugging with gdb, the SIGSEGV occurs on a push instruction with RSP pointing to the top of the stack.
0x7ffd89767000 0x7ffd89f67000 0x800000 0x0 rw-p [stack] (gdb) x/i $pc => 0x557c5dc36938: push %rbx (gdb) x/20wgx $rsp 0x7ffd89767000: 0x00002b59025e1848 0x00002b59025e1888 0x7ffd89767010: 0x00007ffd89767030 0x0000557c5dc3762b 0x7ffd89767020: 0x0000557c5ffc8140 0x00002b5902fd0108 0x7ffd89767030: 0x00007ffd89767060 0x0000557c5dc36c58 0x7ffd89767040: 0x00002b5902fc0000 0x00002b5902fd0108 0x7ffd89767050: 0x00002b59025defc8 0x00002b59025e1848 0x7ffd89767060: 0x00007ffd89767080 0x0000557c5dc3762b 0x7ffd89767070: 0x0000557c5ffc8140 0x00002b5902fd00c8 0x7ffd89767080: 0x00007ffd897670b0 0x0000557c5dc36c58 0x7ffd89767090: 0x00002b5902fc0000 0x00002b5902fd00c8
System details: Chrome Version: 121.0.6167.184 Operating System: Linux 5.4.266-1-MANJARO
I provided a Python script to generate the HTML page that will crash the window trying to load it.
# Summary Stack overflow when loading HTML containing <style> with too many vars()
# Custom Questions #### Crashed report ID: 2212ff8d8b69255a
#### How much crashed? Just one tab
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: When Dev (Unstable) cannot update, it directs the user to the stable download URI, not Dev's.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Install google-chrome-unstable-123.0.6300.3-1.rpm from https://dl.google.com/dl/linux/direct/google-chrome-unstable_current_x86_64.rpm. 1. Wait until there's a new update so that it notifies you to update because you've only installed the RPM, not added the repository URI. 1. Select the prompt.
# Problem Description If you install google-chrome-unstable-123.0.6300.3-1.rpm from https://dl.google.com/dl/linux/direct/google-chrome-unstable_current_x86_64.rpm and wait until there's an update, you'll be prompted to update because you've only installed the RPM, not added the repository URI. If you select that prompt, you'll be directed to https://www.google.com/intl/en_uk/chrome/ rather than https://www.google.com/intl/en_uk/chrome/dev/.
# Additional Comments This is the installer.
# Summary When Dev (Unstable) cannot update, it directs the user to the stable download URI, not Dev's.
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Dev \ Regression: No

entry.title: macOS Universal Links don’t have app icon shown
entry.content: The ui for app intents in Chromium seems to have changed, and the UI that I’m now seeing looks like it should have an app icon, but doesn’t.
